ygData.subject: Re: Wall squad ring
ygData.msgSnippet: I am a cleric and I wear a squad ring and as far as I know the only way you can charge the ring is back in Rivervale and that s if you faction is still good
ygData.messageBody:
I am a cleric and I wear a squad ring and as far as I know the only way
you can charge the ring is back in Rivervale and that's if you faction
is still good with them. I've had it for a while and I have never
found a way to charge it anyway.

Bocler, Fennin Ro

Guild Leader of The Lawkeepers of Norrath

--- "Heather M. Daley" <blushn@...> wrote:
> From: "Heather M. Daley" <blushn@...>
>
> Hi there,
>
> I have no ideas on the wall ring subject, but as far
> as training I am a
> human cleric and i can't train in Kaladim, i don't
> know that there is
> anything that can be done about that.
>
> Lady Bree of Fennin Ro
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Olli Haapam∩┐╜ki
> <olli.haapamaki@...>
> To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> Date: Wednesday, June 09, 1999 6:01 AM
> Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Wall squad ring
>
>
> >From: Olli Haapam∩┐╜ki
> <olli.haapamaki@...>
> >
> >Greetings fellow clerics of Norrath!
> >
> >I am currently playing a Lvl 19 female Dwarf cleric
> at Innoruuk server.
> >
> >I am about to complete the Wall squad ring quest at
> Rivervale (Ghobber
> considers me warmly now... shouldn't take long).
> >
> >Yesterday when i was hunting goblins in Runnyeye
> with full party, someone
> asked me to charge his Wall squad ring. At first i
> started thinking how can
> i do that. Then someone said that only halflings can
> charge them. So i never
> had the chance of trying it. The person who asked me
> to charge the ring
> thought i was a halfling :(. So can't clerics of any
> other race than
> halfling charge these rings?
> >
> >And eh, why the heck the cleric guild at Rivervale
> won't let me train my
> skills? I think i never did anything that could
> worsen my faction standing
> with them. So do i need to raise my faction standing
> with them before they
> will talk to me? Or is this similar case as when any
> Elf tries to trade with
> the Innkeeper at Kaladim (I think Irontoe something
> was his name) and he
> always turns them down. I'm also having the same
> problem with the human
> clerics in Freeport. Do i really have to go all the
> way to Kaladim to be
> able to use my training points?
> >
> >With all the best to fellow Norrathian clerics,
> >Iyenya - Lvl 19 Dwarf cleric - Sons of Serilis
> >Innoruuk server
> >
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
> >Got an opinion?
> >http://www.onelist.com
> >Make it count! Sign up for the ONElist Weekly
> Survey now.
> >
>
